bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an agreement in the form of a licence, permit or agreement referred to in section 12 of the Forest Act, or
a licence or permit under the Range Act

bcl:definition.bcl:text: land use objective means an objective

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: established under section 93.4 of the Act, or
referred to in section 93.8 of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: minister means the minister responsible for the administration of the Land Act;
section 93.4 order means an order made under section 93.4 of the Act for the purposes of the Forest and Range Practices Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Criteria for establishing land use objectives

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a section 93.4 order establishing or significantly amending a land use objective for an area, the minister may consider information that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is contained in a land use plan that is endorsed by the Executive Council and that relates to the area, or
is relevant to the management and use of the forest and range resources within the area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before making a section 93.4 order establishing or significantly amending a land use objective, the minister must be satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the land use objective or amendment will

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: provide for management and use of forest or range resources in a manner that has not otherwise been provided for under this regulation or another enactment, and
provide for an appropriate balance of social, economic and environmental benefits, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the importance of the land use objective or amendment outweighs any adverse impact on opportunities for timber harvesting or forage use within or adjacent to the area that will be affected.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a section 93.4 order establishing or significantly amending a land use objective the minister must consider any written comment received under whichever is applicable of section 3 or 4.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Orders that must be made available for public review and comment

bcl:definition.bcl:text: newspaper includes a free newspaper and a newspaper without subscribers;

order does not include a section 93.4 order that is the subject of an opinion of the minister under section 93.6 (2) of the Act, stated in the order, that the order is urgently required to protect a resource value.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister proposes by order to establish or significantly amend a land use objective, the minister, before making the order, must publish a notice, briefly describing the land use objective or amendment, in a newspaper circulating in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the area in which the land use objective applies, or
if no newspaper circulates in that area, the area nearest to that area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: and in the Gazette, and stating

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the proposed order is publicly available for review and comment at the ministry's regional office for the region that includes the area referred to in paragraph (a),
the date on which the land use objective or the amendment is to take effect,
the period, as determined under subsection (3), during which persons have the opportunity to review, and provide written comments about, the proposed land use objective or amendment, and
the ministry office to which written comments may be sent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The period referred to in subsection (2) (e) is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 60 days beginning on the later of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date the notice is published in a newspaper, and
the date the notice is published in the Gazette

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in accordance with subsection (2), or
a different period that the minister, before publication of the notice, may specify, beginning on the later of the dates referred to in paragraph (a), which period may be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: longer than 60 days, if the minister is satisfied that the longer period is necessary to provide adequate opportunity for review and comment, or

shorter than 60 days, if the minister is satisfied that the shorter period will provide adequate opportunity for review and comment or is necessary to address concerns respecting the protection of resource values.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before the minister makes an order to establish or significantly amend a land use objective, a holder of a forest stewardship plan, woodlot licence plan, range use plan or range stewardship plan must be consulted by an official of the ministry only if both of the following conditions are fulfilled:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the land use objective or amendment, as proposed, would have a material adverse impact on the holder, in relation to any

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: intended results or strategies specified in the plan, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder gives written notice to the minister within the period referred to in subsection (2) (e), requesting the consultation and stating the material adverse impact.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Review and comment on urgent orders by affected agreement holders

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, order means a section 93.4 order that is the subject of an opinion of the minister under section 93.6 (2) of the Act that the order is urgently required to protect a resource value.

If the minister proposes by order to establish or significantly amend a land use objective, the minister, before making the order, must provide agreement holders that may be affected by the order an opportunity to review, and to provide written comments about, the land use objective or amendment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Specifying conflicts with Forest and Range Practices Act objectives

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before making a section 93.4 order establishing or amending a land use objective the minister must determine if the proposed land use objective or the land use objective as proposed to be amended would conflict with other objectives established under the Forest and Range Practices Act.
If the minister determines that the order, if made, would result in a conflict referred to in subsection (1), the minister may make the order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in an amended form that avoids the conflict, or
as proposed, but must specify the nature and extent of the conflict in the order.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of order establishing or amending a land use objective

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A section 93.4 order that establishes or amends a land use objective must be in writing and must specify all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the land use objective or the amendment;
the date on which the land use objective or the amendment is to take effect, if that date is different than the date the order is published in the Gazette;
if section 16 (2) of the Forest and Range Practices Act will be disapplied.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A section 93.4 order that establishes or amends a land use objective must be filed at the regional office for the forest region to which the order relates by the date notice of the order is posted or published under section 7.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of order establishing or amending a land use objective

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister makes a section 93.4 order establishing or significantly amending a land use objective, the minister must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: post notice of the order on the website of the ministry, and
publish notice of the order in the Gazette.
identify that an order has been made that has established or amended a land use objective,
identify where the land use objective or the amendment, as applicable, applies,
specify the date on which the land use objective or the amendment takes effect,
state that the order is filed at the regional office for the forest region to which the order relates, and

state that there is available a summary, filed with the order, of any revision made to the objective as a result of the proposed objective having been made available for review and comment under this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Effective date of a section 93.4 order

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A section 93.4 order takes effect on the later of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date notice is published under section 7 (1) (b), and
the date specified under section 7 (2) (c).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A section 93.4 order does not affect any of the following that are in effect at the beginning of the day the order takes effect:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a cutting permit;
a road permit;
a timber sale licence that does not provide for cutting permits;
an area described in section 7 (1) (b) or 196 (1) of the Forest and Range Practices Act;
a schedule, as it applies for the calendar year in which the order is made, which schedule is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in a range use plan for grazing of livestock and is referred to in section 33 (1) (b) of the Forest and Range Practices Act,
in a range use plan for hay cutting and is referred to in section 34 (1) (b) of that Act, or
required under section 43 of that Act, in relation to a range stewardship plan.

reg:content.reg:regnote: Note: this regulation repeals B.C. Reg. 180/95 made under the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act.
